description:
Variation of condition No. 4 (The glazed barriers and seating area hereby approved shall only be in place between the hours of 08:00am until 11.30pm on Sunday to Thursday and 08:00am until midnight on Friday
and Saturday) of planning permission Ref:P1469.22 dated 18/11/2022 to permit the barriers to remain in place at all times (Existing pavement cafe barriers to be replaced with semi-permanent fixed glazed barriers)
decision_conditions: The proposal would by reason of its permanence, design and layout, obstruct the highway and safe and convenient pedestrian movement harmful to highway safety and is likely to give rise to the increased potential for crime and anti-social behaviour to the detriment of the amenity of surrounding residents and the general public contrary to Policies 14 and 26 of the Havering Local Plan, Policies D11, SD6 and T2 of the London Plan and the guidance contained in the National Planning Policy Framework, including paragraph 130, which requires developments to create places that are safe and where crime and disorder, and the fear or crime, do not undermine the quality of life or community cohesion and resilience.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to K D Paine & Associates Ltd via email on 3rd February 2023.
